item.title: Meg add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "If you treat an individual as he is, he will remain how he is. But if you treat him as if he were what he ought to be and could be, he will become what he ought to be and could be." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Meg add a quote by Thomas Fuller
item.description: "All things are difficult before they are easy." -- Thomas Fuller

item.title: Meg add a quote by Booker T. Washington
item.description: "You can't hold a man down without staying down with him." -- Booker T. Washington

item.title: Meg add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Bad artists copy. Good artists steal." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Meg add a quote by oscar wilde
item.description: "Only the shallow know themselves" -- oscar wilde

item.title: Meg add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Meg add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Meg add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Meg add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "I don't know anything with certainty, but seeing the stars makes me dream." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Meg add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Meg add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I have heard there are troubles of more than one kind. Some come from ahead and some come from behind. But I've bought a big bat. I'm all ready you see. Now my troubles are going to have troubles with me!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Meg add a quote by Cecelia Ahern
item.description: "Life... It's a great and terrible and short and endless thing. None of us come out of it alive." -- Cecelia Ahern

item.title: Meg add a quote by Peter Hedges
item.description: "Love is not a feeling.Â It's an ability." -- Peter Hedges

item.title: Meg add a quote by Rod Stewart
item.description: "Instead of getting married again, I'm going to find a woman I don't like and just give her a house." -- Rod Stewart

item.title: Meg add a quote by Tony Hoagland
item.description: "What I thought was an end turned out to be a middle. What I thought was a brick wall turned out to be a tunnel. What I thought was an injustice turned out to be a color of the sky." -- Tony Hoagland

item.title: Meg add a quote by Auguste Rodin
item.description: "Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely." -- Auguste Rodin

item.title: Meg add a quote by Paul Gauguin
item.description: "We never really know what stupidity is until we have experimented on ourselves." -- Paul Gauguin

item.title: Meg add a quote by Will Rogers
item.description: "There are two theories to arguing with a woman. Neither works." -- Will Rogers

item.title: Meg add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Meg add a quote by Texas Bix Bender
item.description: "Never miss a good chance to shut up." -- Texas Bix Bender

item.title: Meg add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "Never go to a doctor whose office plants have died." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Meg add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I'd rather be an optimist and a fool than a pessimist and right." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Meg add a quote by Eric Weiner
item.description: "[Happiness is] a ghost, itâs a shadow. You canât really chase it. Itâs a by-product, a very pleasant side effect to a life lived well." -- Eric Weiner

item.title: Meg add a quote by Barbara Benedek
item.description: "More isn't always better. Sometimes it's just more." -- Barbara Benedek

item.title: Meg add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Talking about music is like dancing about architecture." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Meg add a quote by Jack Johnson
item.description: "The wisdom's in the trees not the glass windows." -- Jack Johnson

item.title: Meg add a quote by Buckminster Fuller
item.description: "God is a Verb." -- Buckminster Fuller

item.title: Meg add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Meg add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "It's not how much we give but how much love we put into giving." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: Meg add a quote by Alexis de Tocqueville
item.description: "The American Republic will endure until the day Congress discovers that it can bribe the public with the public's money." -- Alexis de Tocqueville
